intro: Euphrasia americana, commonly known as the American eyebright, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shady woodlands and along stream banks. The plant features small, yellowish-green flowers with prominent veins, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Euphrasia americana is part of the Scrophulariaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental value.
